Resource.Header: All You Need to Know About Buyer’s Closing Costs
Resource.Description: Th home buying experience can be exciting. You’re ready to settle down or upgrade to more space for your family. But with all the action surrounding getting pre-approved, finding a reputable Real Estate Agent and vising open houses, there’s one thing that can’t be forgotten during the excitement – your closing costs.

Resource.Header: Avoid These Common Mistakes When Selling Your Home
Resource.Description: It’s time consuming, it can be emotional, it’s overwhelming – let’s face it, it’s A LOT when you’re looking to put your home on the market. First time home sellers may find the process frustrating and it’s very common for mistakes to be made during the process. Check out the biggest mistakes to avoid when looking to sell your home.

Resource.Header: Navigating Today’s Hot Real Estate Market – How To Land A Deal
Resource.Description: Supply is low which is pushing home prices higher and higher. In this hot market, it can be hard for buyer’s to land a deal. We break it down to four simple steps below on how to navigate the market and come out on top when searching for your next home.

Resource.Header: Why Should I Get Pre-Approved For A Mortgage?
Resource.Description: You’re moving across the country – how exciting! Before you start loading up your moving truck, you want to find a place to live. Just landed your dream job – so many feelings and emotions. Let’s get the contract signed before you start decorating your office. The same mindset comes into play when you’re looking to purchase a new home. Your first step to ensure everything goes smoothly? Get pre-approved. Serious homebuyers should start the process by obtaining their pre-approval letter, not by visiting an abundance of open houses.

Resource.Header: Reasons Why You Should Refinance Your Mortgage
Resource.Description: Unless you’re living under a rock, we’re sure you’ve heard the news that interest rates are at ALL TIME LOWS. But what does this mean? If you are finding it difficult to service your mortgage, or wish to benefit from lower interest rates, you can opt for refinancing. Many private and government-controlled home refinancing programs are available to the general public. As long as you meet their criteria, you can refinance your mortgage.
